timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from jenkinsci/master

Updating fork

Merge pull request #2 from jenkinsci/master

Updating with new commits
Adding additional test files for JUnit

timeline.bodyText: Since junit is already used for the test results (junit plugin) we need to use a different name here: what about junitParser.
timeline.author: uhafner

timeline.bodyText: Overwrite getUrl with link to JUnit.
timeline.author: uhafner

timeline.bodyText: Can you check if we can include the JUnit 5 logo as well? It would be niche to have the reports linked with the official new logo https://junit.org/junit5/.
timeline.author: uhafner

replies.bodyText:
How will I link the reports with junit logo?
Should I download and store the logo into icons folder and use override getLabelProvider() in JUnit.java
replies.author: Gyanesha

replies.bodyText: Yes, you need to overwrite that method, here is an example: https://github.com/jenkinsci/warnings-ng-plugin/blob/master/src/main/java/io/jenkins/plugins/analysis/warnings/EsLint.java#L69
replies.author: uhafner

replies.bodyText: The icons belong to the icons folder and should be in 48x48 and 24x24 PNG. In the near feature I will change that to SVG but we can add that later on...
replies.author: uhafner

replies.bodyText: Ok. thanks, Do you know if they did specify the license somewhere? Then we can add a corresponding line in https://github.com/jenkinsci/warnings-ng-plugin/blob/master/src/main/webapp/icons/LICENSE.txt
replies.author: uhafner

replies.bodyText:
They have a license for the source code distribution https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/LICENSE.md.
THE ACCOMPANYING PROGRAM IS PROVIDED UNDER THE TERMS OF THIS ECLIPSE PUBLIC LICENSE (“AGREEMENT”). ANY USE, REPRODUCTION OR DISTRIBUTION OF THE PROGRAM CONSTITUTES RECIPIENT'S ACCEPTANCE OF THIS AGREEMENT.
Should I ask them ?
replies.author: Gyanesha

replies.bodyText: That would be nice! I always have a bad feeling with icons that do not have the license correctly set.
replies.author: uhafner

replies.bodyText:
Yes, wonderful! You can link to the GitHub issue in the license.txt file.
Please also add the URL to JUnit with getUrl (see comment above) and then I will merge your changes!
replies.author: uhafner

replies.bodyText: Sorry for not mentioning it beforehand, but I have already added the URL to JUnit with getUrl().
replies.author: Gyanesha

timeline.message:
Revert "Removing files from .github"

This reverts commit 6677aa6044ca3ad612f28b8099ed2a9a1cbb0405.
